content: winter wonderland keyhole scarf laigny noelle designs - knittykittylove on ravelry note this pattern was designed for a month-long mcal so it is written in 5 separate parts hook g - 4 25mm yarn - worsted weight sunset - caron simply soft paints mc for part 1 and part 2 86 6 yards merry and bright - big twist value ombre part 3 and part 4 109 4 yards merry and bright - big twist value ombre part 5 32 4 yards aran tweed - loops & threads impeccable tweed w for part 1 and part 2 19 7 yards black - unknown b for part 1 3 0 yards colors part 1 - if your parts 3 and 4 are a mostly solid or tonal darker color then you can use this color as the background color for part 1 if there are lighter colors in your parts 3 and 4 especially white i suggest using a different colorway for part 1 s background i am using a dark red tonal yarn for the background of both part 1 and part 2 for the 1st contrast color i suggest a white but a pale blue or pink might work as well i am using a white tweed because that is all i have on hand for the 2nd contrast color i suggest using black or brown i am using black part 2 - i would use the same background color you used for part 1 for part 2 unless you want to do 2 different solid colors 1 for part 1 and 1 for part 2 for contrast color i suggest using the same 1st contrast color as part 1 white part 3 - you can use whatever variegated solid ombre or striped yarn you love that is in a winter-y or christmas-y colorway i am using a red/green/white variegated but know that i love wacky color combos… parts 3 and 4 are the main parts of this object part 4 - continue with yarn from part 3 part 5 - i would use the same yarn as parts 3 and 4 just attaching the parts pattern note for changing colors you will be using only dcs for parts 1 and 2 as you know each double_crochet involves step 1 going through the first 2 of 3 loops then step 2 going through the remaining 2 loops every time you have a color change for the next stitch you will pull the upcoming color change through step 2 the remaining 2 loops of the yarn you are finishing part 1 mc is the background color for parts 1 and 2 this might be the same as your parts 3 and 4 color w is white b is black when you finish a w or b section drop the yarn behind your work and pick up on the next pass carry the mc yarn through your stitches the entire way so there is no ws or rs you will need
